tuv.seg: As an alternative to imposing a custodial sentence, the courts can impose restrictions on the movements of those convicted of some minor offences
Mar mhalairt ar phianbhreith choimeádta a ghearradh, is féidir leis na cúirteanna srianta a ghearradh ar ghluaiseachtaí daoine a ciontaíodh as roinnt mionchionta
These restrictions are known as restriction on movement orders and were introduced under Section 101 of the Criminal Justice Act 2006
Tugtar orduithe srianta gluaiseachta ar na srianta seo agus tugadh isteach iad faoi Alt 101 den Acht um Cheartas Coiriúil 2006
A restriction on movement order only applies where someone aged 18 years or over has been convicted by the court and sentenced to a term of imprisonment of 3 months or more
Ní bhíonn ordú srianta gluaiseachta i bhfeidhm ach nuair a ciontaíonn an chúirt duine éigin darb aois 18 mbliana nó níos mó agus nuair a ghearrtar téarma príosúnachta orthu de 3 mhí nó níos mó
The court cannot impose a restriction on movement order for a period longer than 6 months
Ní féidir leis an gcúirt ordú srianta gluaiseachta a ghearradh ar feadh tréimhse níos faide ná 6 mhí
What restrictions can the order impose on me?
Cén srianta ar féidir leis an ordú a ghearradh orm?
The order can restrict your movements as the court considers appropriate and may include a curfew element
Is féidir leis an ordú do ghluaiseachtaí a shrianadh de réir mar a mheasann an chúirt atá cuí agus b’fhéidir go mbeadh cuirfiú mar chuid de
This would oblige you to be in a particular place for a particular period
Chuirfeadh sé seo oibleagáid ort a bheith in áit ar leith ar feadh tréimhse áirithe
For example, you may be required to be at your home between the hours of 8pm and 8am
Mar shampla, bheadh ort bheith i do theach idir uaireanta 8i.n. agus 8 r.n
Similarly, the order could include a prohibition forbidding you from being in a particular place for a particular period
Ar an dóigh chéanna, d’fhéadfadh an t-ordú toirmeasc a chur ort bheith in áit áirithe ar feadh tréimhse áirithe
For example, you may be required to stay away from a certain named street or premises between 8pm and 8am
Mar shampla, b’fhéidir go mbeadh ort fanacht ar shiúl ó shráid nó áitreabh ainmnithe áirithe idir 8i.n. agus 8r.n
An order cannot require you to remain in a place or places for more than 12 hours in a day
Ní féidir le hordú iallach a chur ort fanacht in áit nó in áiteanna ar feadh tréimhse níos mó ná 12 uaire in aon lá amháin
The court arranges for a copy of the restriction on movement order to be sent to the Garda station which looks after the area where the offender resides
Socraíonn an chúirt go gcuirfí cóip den ordú srianta gluaiseachta chuig stáisiún na nGardaí a bhfuil freagracht aige as an gceantar a bhfuil an ciontóir ina chónaí ann
Can orders be changed or varied after they are made?
An féidir orduithe a athrú tar éis a ndéanta?
A court may vary an order on the written application of the following people:
Is féidir le cúirt ordú a athrú ar iarratas scríofa a fháil ó dhuine de na daoine seo a leanas:
• The owner of the premises specified in the order
• Úinéir an áitribh atá sainráite san ordú
• An adult normally resident at the premises specified in the order
• Duine fásta ar ghnáth-áit chónaithe dó an t-áitreabh atá sainráite san ordú
• A member of the Garda Síochána
• Ball den Gharda Síochána
The court may vary the order by substituting another place or period of time for the place or time already specified in the order
Is féidir leis an gcúirt an t-ordú a athrú trí áit nó tréimhse ama eile a chur isteach in áit na háite nó na tréimhse atá sainráite san ordú cheana féin
Can I have more than one restriction on movement order placed on me?
An féidir leis na cúirteanna níos mó ná aon ordú srianta gluaiseachta a chur orm?
Where more than one order is in place, however, the period of time that you are required to remain at a place or places cannot exceed 6 months
Nuair a bhíonn níos mó ná aon ordú in áit, áfach, ní féidir leis an dtréimhse ama is gá duit fanacht in áit nó in áiteanna dul thar 6 mhí

Where orders are imposed for two or more offences they may be concurrent – that is, they run at the same time – or they may be consecutive – that is, the second order will only begin when the first order finishes

Nuair a ghearrtar orduithe as dhá chion nó níos mó is féidir leo a bheith comhthráthach – is é sin, is féidir leo rith ag an am céanna – nó is féidir leo a bheith comhleantach – is é sin, ní thosóidh an dara hordú go dtí go gcríochnóidh an chéad ordú
In either event the total period of time that you are required to remain at a place or places cannot exceed a maximum of 6 months
I gceachtar den dá chás, ní bheidh an tréimhse ama a gcaithfidh tú fanacht in aon áit nó in áiteanna a bheith níos mó ná uasmhéid de 6 mhí
What happens if I fail to comply with the order?
Cad a tharlóidh mura gcomhlíonfaidh mé an t-ordú?
As the Gardai in your area receive a copy of your order from the court, they have responsibility for ensuring you comply with it
Nuair a fhaigheann na Gardaí i do cheantar cóip den ordú ón gcúirt, beidh siad freagrach as a chinntiú go gcomhlíonann tú é
If the Gardai are of the opinion that you have breached the order they can go back to the court and let the court know
Má tá na Gardaí den bharúil gur sháraigh tú an t-ordú is féidir leo dul ar ais chun na cúirte agus é sin a a chur in iúl don chúirt
If the court considers that you have breached the order the court can do any of the following:
Má mheasann an chúirt gur sháraigh tú an t-ordú is féidir leis an gcúirt aon cheann de na rudaí seo a leanas a dhéanamh:
• Direct you to comply with the order
• Tú a threorú leis an ordú a chomhlíonadh
• Cancel the order and impose another restriction on movement order on you
• An t-ordú a chur ar ceal agus ordú eile srianta gluaiseachta a ghearradh ort
• Cancel the order and deal with your case in whatever other way it could have been dealt with before the order was made
• An t-ordú a chealú agus déileáil le do chás ar cibé dóigh eile a d’fhéadfaí déileáil leis sula ndearnadh an t-ordú
In reality this means that the court has the power to re-activate or to impose the original prison sentence and send you to jail, if you fail to obey the restriction of movement order

Is féidir orduithe srianta gluaiseachta a ghearradh ar dhaoine as na cionta seo a leanas faoin Cacht um Cheartas Coiriúil (Ord Poiblí) 1994 agus faoin Acht um Chionta Neamh-Mharfacha In Aghaidh an Duine 1997:
What are the offences for which a restriction of movement order can be imposed?
• Alt 8: (mainneachtain ordachán ó Chomhalta den Gharda Síochána a chomhlíonadh)
